channel.title: CalYoga - Yoga Instruction & Video Podcast
channel.description: CalYoga Video Learning Series.Join Master Instructor Byron Miller for the Calyoga Ashtanga Learning Series. These 2-3 minute video vignettes are "to the point", easy to use, and designed with today's active lifestyles in mind.Cal Yoga specializes in private and public instruction of Hatha Yoga, including variations of Ashtanga, Martial Arts, Pilates and Tai Chi, Qigong and Ballet.
channel.itunes:summary: CalYoga Video Learning Series.Join Master Instructor Byron Miller for the Calyoga Ashtanga Learning Series. These 2-3 minute video vignettes are "to the point", easy to use, and designed with today's active lifestyles in mind.Cal Yoga specializes in private and public instruction of Hatha Yoga, including variations of Ashtanga, Martial Arts, Pilates and Tai Chi, Qigong and Ballet.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Calyoga Ashtanga Learning Series by Master Instructor Byron Miller
channel.itunes:author: Byron Miller
channel.itunes:keywords: Cal, California, CalYoga, Hatha, Yoga, Astanga, Martial Arts, Pilates, Tai Chi, Qiqong, Ballet, Instruction

item.title: Episode #66 | Pradiipadyasana
item.description: Pradiipadyasana - aka Candle. Typically performed as a way to safely exit a prolonged shoulder stand or plow posture, make sure the chin is tucked and the spine curved as you role forward (slowly) out of the pose.ere are many elements of classical ballet in play. Make sure to engage the "Bandas" while focusing on the proper "Driste".. The series is much easier to do if one flows with a proper breathing pattern inhaling on the up moves and exhaling when descending. Once mastered leg/core strength is assured.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Candle" pose
item.itunes:summary: Pradiipadyasana - aka Candle – Typically performed as a way to safely exit a prolonged shoulder stand or plow posture, make sure the chin is tucked as you role forward (slowly) out of the pose..
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #65 | Dwi-pada Anantasana
item.description: Pradiipadyasana - aka Candle. Typically performed as a way to safely exit a prolonged shoulder stand or plow posture, make sure the chin is tucked and the spine curved as you role forward (slowly) out of the pose.ere are many elements of classical ballet in play. Make sure to engage the "Bandas" while focusing on the proper "Driste".. The series is much easier to do if one flows with a proper breathing pattern inhaling on the up moves and exhaling when descending. Once mastered leg/core strength is assured.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Extended 2 Legged Infinite Pose " pose
item.itunes:summary: Dwi-pada Anantasana aka - Extended 2 Legged Infinite Pose – Emphasis is on sculpting the hard to get rid of “love handle” area. Feel the pose above/below the hip as you lift and descend.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #64 | Vipatayati
item.description: Vipatayati - The "Glider" pose requires full concentration. There are many elements of classical ballet in play. Make sure to engage the "Bandas" while focusing on the proper "Driste".. The series is much easier to do if one flows with a proper breathing pattern inhaling on the up moves and exhaling when descending. Once mastered leg/core strength is assured.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Glider" pose
item.itunes:summary: Vipatayati - The "Glider" pose requires full concentration. There are many elements of classical ballet in play. Make sure to engage the "Bandas" while focusing on the proper "Driste".. The series is much easier to do if one flows with a proper breathing pattern inhaling on the up moves and exhaling when descending. Once mastered leg/core strength is assured..
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #63 | Marichyasana A
item.description: Marichyasana A - aka as the "bound forward hand around the knee pose", once bound; make sure to lead with the sternum, drawing the arms back in opposition. The straight leg remains active during the entire routine.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Bound forward hand around the knee pose"
item.itunes:summary: Marichyasana A - aka as the "bound forward hand around the knee pose", once bound; make sure to lead with the sternum, drawing the arms back in opposition. The straight leg remains active during the entire routine.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #62 | Vimanena
item.description: Vimanena - aka the "Glider or Arabesque" places a premium on leg strength/endurance and grace. As the leg rises the upper core acts as a centering station for the posture. Keep the chest open arching the torso. Pay attention to the placement and positioning of the arms, hands and fingers.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Glider or Arabesque"
item.itunes:summary: Vimanena - aka the "Glider or Arabesque" places a premium on leg strength/endurance and grace. As the leg rises the upper core acts as a centering station for the posture. Keep the chest open arching the torso. Pay attention to the placement and positioning of the arms, hands and fingers.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #61 | Padahastasana
item.description: Padahastasana - aka the "Foot to Hand Posture" enables stretching of the hamstrings as well as the lower back. Start by putting emphasis on the heels, and then you may experiment with weight transfer, gently rocking from the heels to the balls of the feet and vice-versa. Do not to push forward too much, as you my lose your balance (falling forward ) on your face. Ouch!
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Foot to Hand Posture"
item.itunes:summary: Padahastasana - aka the "Foot to Hand Posture" enables stretching of the hamstrings as well as the lower back. Start by putting emphasis on the heels, and then you may experiment with weight transfer, gently rocking from the heels to the balls of the feet and vice-versa. Do not to push forward too much, as you my lose your balance (falling forward ) on your face. Ouch!
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #60 | Eka Pada Parsva Sarvangansana
item.description: Eka Pada Parsva Sarvangansana - aka the "2 legged Side Should-stand" places a premium on core strength as well as balance. The effect is much like a scale, slowly finding center as the legs descend and rotate. Go slow and utilize a spotter for safety.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "2 legged Side Should-stand"
item.itunes:summary: Eka Pada Parsva Sarvangansana - aka the "2 legged Side Should-stand" places a premium on core strength as well as balance. The effect is much like a scale, slowly finding center as the legs descend and rotate. Go slow and utilize a spotter for safety.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #59 | Shalabhasana
item.description: Shalabhasana - The "Locust" position requires core and buttock power. Imagine rolling up and forward (with the breath) as opposed to straining. Keep the weight centered on the chin, and the back side becomes much lighter and willing to roll forward with gravity, as opposed to lifting by using brute force.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Locust"
item.itunes:summary: Shalabhasana - The "Locust" position requires core and buttock power. Imagine rolling up and forward (with the breath) as opposed to straining. Keep the weight centered on the chin, and the back side becomes much lighter and willing to roll forward with gravity, as opposed to lifting by using brute force.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #58 | Ardha Matsyendrasana
item.description: Ardha Matsyendrasana - The "Half Lord of the Fishes" posture is a series of spinal twists. Focus on keeping the crown of the head lifted, as an extension of the entire spinal column. Keep the column straight up and down (like a rod), simultaneously rotating the torso around the anchor.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Half Lord of the Fishes"
item.itunes:summary: Ardha Matsyendrasana - The "Half Lord of the Fishes" posture is a series of spinal twists. Focus on keeping the crown of the head lifted, as an extension of the entire spinal column. Keep the column straight up and down (like a rod), simultaneously rotating the torso around the anchor.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #57 | Kumbhakasana / Chaturanga Dandasana
item.description: Kumbhakasana / Chaturanga Dandasana - The "Plank" requires sensitivity to all parts of the body. Rather than struggling imagine floating with the weight distributed equally between the hands, hips and feet. The "Four limbed" position is similar. Visualize even weight allotment between the arms and legs, sometimes referred to as the 4 equal posts posture.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Plank"
item.itunes:summary: Kumbhakasana / Chaturanga Dandasana - The "Plank" requires sensitivity to all parts of the body. Rather than struggling imagine floating with the weight distributed equally between the hands, hips and feet. The "Four limbed" position is similar. Visualize even weight allotment between the arms and legs, sometimes referred to as the 4 equal posts posture.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #56 | Marichasana / Utthita Hasta Padungushtasnana
item.description: Marichasana / Utthita Hasta Padungushtasnana – "The Pose of the Sage Marichi" stretches the Achilles Tendon and the arch of the foot. When learning the position, hold the foot with the opposite arm until finding center. When practicing the "Hand to Big Toe Pose" visualize taking a step forward to standup. Have a spotter, as there is a tendency to fall backwards.
item.itunes:subtitle: "The Pose of the Sage Marichi"
item.itunes:summary: Marichasana / Utthita Hasta Padungushtasnana - "The Pose of the Sage Marichi" stretches the Achilles Tendon and the arch of the foot. When learning the position, hold the foot with the opposite arm until finding center. When practicing the "Hand to Big Toe Pose" visualize taking a step forward to standup. Have a spotter, as there is a tendency to fall backwards.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #55 | Ardha Baddha Padma Prapardasnana
item.description: Ardha Baddha Padma Prapardasnana – The "Half Bound Lotus Tiptoe Pose" requires balance, focus, foot and ankle strength. Pranayama Breathing is essential for equilibrium. Practice with your back 1-3 inches away from a wall.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Half Bound Lotus Tiptoe Pose"
item.itunes:summary: Ardha Baddha Padma Prapardasnana - The "Half Bound Lotus Tiptoe Pose" requires balance, focus, foot and ankle strength. Pranayama Breathing is essential for equilibrium. Practice with your back 1-3 inches away from a wall.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #54 | Ardha Sarvangasana / Urdhva Padmasana
item.description: Ardha Sarvangasana / Urdhva Padmasana - The "One Legged Shoulder Stand" is an inversion pose that works with gravity. Relax; slow down the breath allowing the stretch to go deeper. While the "Inverted Lotus" enables a heightened sense of awareness, a very nice position for meditation.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "One Legged Shoulder Stand"
item.itunes:summary: Ardha Sarvangasana/Urdhva Padmasana - The "One Legged Shoulder Stand" is an inversion pose that works with gravity. Relax; slow down the breath allowing the stretch to go deeper. While the "Inverted Lotus" enables a heightened sense of awareness, a very nice position for meditation.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #53 | Agni-Prasana
item.description: Agni-Prasana — aka the "Breath of Fire" will entirely charge the nervous system, causing the glands to secrete and purify the blood. When it is done with certain postures and movements, which are meant to put contracting (drawing in) or expanding (releasing) pressure in nerve plexuses and glandular centers, those areas are made to fire and become completely charged.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Breath of Fire"
item.itunes:summary: Agni-Prasana – aka the "Breath of Fire" will entirely charge the nervous system, causing the glands to secrete and purify the blood. When it is done with certain postures and movements, which are meant to put contracting (drawing in) or expanding (releasing) pressure in nerve plexuses and glandular centers, those areas are made to fire and become completely charged.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #52 | Shitali Pranayama
item.description: Cooling breath — aka as "Shitali Pranayama" is a 5000 year old technique for cooling one’s body temperature down. Typically performed at the end of a yoga session, it acts as a natural alternative to consuming too much liquid on a warm day.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Cooling breath"
item.itunes:summary: Cooling breath – aka as "Shitali Pranayama" is a 5000 year old technique for cooling one’s body temperature down. Typically performed at the end of a yoga session, it acts as a natural alternative to consuming too much liquid on a warm day.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #51 | Mukha Bastrika
item.description: Mukha Bastrika — aka the "Cleansing Breath", helps to remove old, stagnant air from the lungs and cleanses the bloodstream of excess carbon dioxide, which is associated with mental fatigue, altered nerve sensations and physical weakness. The Cleansing Breath, as its name indicates, cleans and ventilates the lungs; it also tones up the entire respiratory system.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Cleansing Breath"
item.itunes:summary: Mukha Bastrika – aka the "Cleansing Breath", helps to remove old, stagnant air from the lungs and cleanses the bloodstream of excess carbon dioxide, which is associated with mental fatigue, altered nerve sensations and physical weakness. The Cleansing Breath, as its name indicates, cleans and ventilates the lungs; it also tones up the entire respiratory system.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #50 | Anuloma Viloma
item.description: Anuloma Viloma — aka the "Alternate Nostril Breathing Method", is balancing, relaxing, and calming...and can alleviate the symptoms of stress as well as migraine headaches. The exercise produces optimum function to both sides of the brain: that is optimum creativity and optimum logical cerebral activity. This will lead to a balance between a person's creative and logical thinking. Yogis consider this to be the best technique to calm the mind and the Nervous System.
item.itunes:subtitle: Alternate Nostril Breathing Method
item.itunes:summary: Anuloma Viloma - aka the "Alternate Nostril Breathing Method", is balancing, relaxing, and calming...and can alleviate the symptoms of stress as well as migraine headaches. The exercise produces optimum function to both sides of the brain: that is optimum creativity and optimum logical cerebral activity. This will lead to a balance between a person's creative and logical thinking. Yogis consider this to be the best technique to calm the mind and the Nervous System.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #49 | Adhva Samakonasana
item.description: The "Spider" develops equal strength and endurance in both our left and right sides. Arm and Leg positions aided by pressure acceleration/deceleration equate overall balance. Make sure to keep the chin tucked tightly to the collarbone, looking back thru the legs towards the heavens.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Spider"
item.itunes:summary: The "Spider" develops equal strength and endurance in both our left and right sides. Arm and Leg positions aided by pressure acceleration/deceleration equate overall balance. Make sure to keep the chin tucked tightly to the collarbone, looking back thru the legs towards the heavens.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #48 | Ardha Bhekasana
item.description: The "Frog" improves hip/knee rotational flexibility, while providing a deep stretch to the complete shoulder area. Move slowly into the position, take your time, and use the breath to extend the kneecap towards the earth. Do not force it.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Frog"
item.itunes:summary: The "Frog" improves hip/knee rotational flexibility, while providing a deep stretch to the complete shoulder area. Move slowly into the position, take your time, and use the breath to extend the kneecap towards the earth. Do not force it.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #47 | Garudasana
item.description: The "Standing Eagle" promotes balance and flexibility for the hips, shoulders, and hands. It is one of the only poses that you should start with bended knees, but as you accelerate upwards, of course the legs should be straightened. Keep the eyes and breath steady. Do not let the position steal your breath.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Standing Eagle"
item.itunes:summary: The "Standing Eagle" promotes balance and flexibility for the hips, shoulders, and hands. It is one of the only poses that you should start with bended knees, but as you accelerate upwards, of course the legs should be straightened. Keep the eyes and breath steady. Do not let the position steal your breath.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #46 | Setu Bandha Sarvangasana/Urdhva Dhanurasana
item.description: The "Bridge/Wheel" are both inversion positions. With the heart upside down, the breath should be longer and deeper. Relax the neck and shoulders; push the weight forward into the quadriceps/knees feet, while simultaneously dropping the tailbone towards the earth. Go slow!
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Bridge/Wheel"
item.itunes:summary: The "Bridge/Wheel" are both inversion positions. With the heart upside down, the breath should be longer and deeper. Relax the neck and shoulders; push the weight forward into the quadriceps/knees feet, while simultaneously dropping the tailbone towards the earth. Go slow!
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #45 | Pasasana
item.description: The "Noose" will improve balance, while emphasizing flexibility for the Achilles Tendons. Again one finger is all it takes to make the bind. A strap is a good idea for beginners, and you may also use the wall to support yourself, if balance is an issue.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Noose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Noose" will improve balance, while emphasizing flexibility for the Achilles Tendons. Again one finger is all it takes to make the bind. A strap is a good idea for beginners, and you may also use the wall to support yourself, if balance is an issue.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #44 | Dandasana
item.description: The "Staff" stretch will help with your overall posture. Additionally, the hamstrings, calf muscles and the Achilles tendon are stretched. Practice using the mirror. Don't be lazy, keep the position active, and be precise, try to keep the body at a 45 degree angle (exactly).
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Staff" stretch
item.itunes:summary: The "Staff" stretch will help with your overall posture. Additionally, the hamstrings, calf muscles and the Achilles tendon are stretched. Practice using the mirror. Don't be lazy, keep the position active, and be precise, try to keep the body at a 45 degree angle (exactly).
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #43 | Gomukhasana
item.description: The "Archer or Cow Face" increase the range of motion for the entire shoulder area. If the reach is impossible, use a yoga strap or towel, because all you need is one finger to make the bind. Each time you practice the position, it will become easier.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Archer or Cow Face"
item.itunes:summary: The "Archer or Cow Face" increase the range of motion for the entire shoulder area. If the reach is impossible, use a yoga strap or towel, because all you need is one finger to make the bind. Each time you practice the position, it will become easier.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #42 | Natarajasana
item.description: The "Lord of the Dance Pose" poses a real test as to leg strength and endurance. When practicing the routine, do not be in a hurry, keep the eyes focused in one area, and remember to breathe deeply using the pranayama guidelines.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Lord of the Dance Pose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Lord of the Dance Pose" poses a real test as to leg strength and endurance. When practicing the routine, do not be in a hurry, keep the eyes focused in one area, and remember to breathe deeply using the pranayama guidelines.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #41 | Rajakapotasana
item.description: Eka Pada Rajakapotasana "One-Legged King Pigeon Pose" takes us on a journey into deep backbends. Moving into the preparation of this pose the simple pigeon deeply works the hips/ groins and helps to release tension in this pelvic region of our bodies. It requires steady balance while curving backward. The pose is named after a dove or pigeon with its chest puffed up. The backbend action of the torso also works the shoulders into an open position, helping to open the lungs.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "One-Legged King Pigeon Pose"
item.itunes:summary: Eka Pada Rajakapotasana "One-Legged King Pigeon Pose" takes us on a journey into deep backbends. Moving into the preparation of this pose the simple pigeon deeply works the hips/ groins and helps to release tension in this pelvic region of our bodies. It requires steady balance while curving backward. The pose is named after a dove or pigeon with its chest puffed up. The backbend action of the torso also works the shoulders into an open position, helping to open the lungs.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #40 | Eka Pada Adho Mukha Svanasana
item.description: The "One Legged Dog" stretch increases the strength and flexibility of the shoulders. Additionally, the hamstrings, calf muscles and the Achilles tendon are stretched. The hamstring muscles in the raised leg, the biceps in the arms and the gluteus muscles and some lower back muscles are toned.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "One Legged Dog"
item.itunes:summary: The "One Legged Dog" stretch increases the strength and flexibility of the shoulders. Additionally, the hamstrings, calf muscles and the Achilles tendon are stretched. The hamstring muscles in the raised leg, the biceps in the arms and the gluteus muscles and some lower back muscles are toned.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #39 | Ardha Pincha Mayurasana
item.description: The "Dolphin" focuses the attention on a maximum elongation of the spine extending the sacrum to the heavens while pushing the heels down in opposition. Pay special attention to the breath...proper inhalation/exhalation when ascending/descending.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Dolphin"
item.itunes:summary: The "Dolphin" focuses the attention on a maximum elongation of the spine extending the sacrum to the heavens while pushing the heels down in opposition. Pay special attention to the breath...proper inhalation/exhalation when ascending/descending.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #38 | Parivritta Parsvakonasana - Part 2
item.description: In the advanced "Reverse Prayer", when binding, standing and moving, do not rush the routine. The breath may be labored due to distension of the diaphragm...relax and do your best to breathe deeply...stay calm.
item.itunes:subtitle: The advanced "Reverse Prayer"
item.itunes:summary: In the advanced "Reverse Prayer", when binding, standing and moving, do not rush the routine. The breath may be labored due to distension of the diaphragm...relax and do your best to breathe deeply...stay calm.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #37 | Parivritta Parsvakonasana - Part 1
item.description: Performing the "Reverse Prayer" you should plant the back leg firmly to the earth. Keep the neck rotated looking up and back while pointing the heart to the heavens, opening the lungs and twisting the torso.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Reverse Prayer"
item.itunes:summary: Performing the "Reverse Prayer" you should plant the back leg firmly to the earth. Keep the neck rotated looking up and back while pointing the heart to the heavens, opening the lungs and twisting the torso.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #36 | Janu Sirisasana
item.description: The "Head to Knee Pose" It brings a superior balance and awakens the subtle energies of the body. It stretches the hamstrings,sacrum and perinium. A little bend in the elbows will assist in keeping the back straight pushing the sacrum forward, pressing the sturnem towards the earth.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Head to Knee Pose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Head to Knee Pose" It brings a superior balance and awakens the subtle energies of the body. It stretches the hamstrings,sacrum and perinium. A little bend in the elbows will assist in keeping the back straight pushing the sacrum forward, pressing the sturnem towards the earth.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #35 | Bhujapidasana
item.description: The "Arm Pressure Pose" is like swinging in a cradle. Cross and Squeeze your legs together tightly. Think about floating.... be light. Since it is an awkard starting position do not let manueving into the position, steal your breath.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Arm Pressure Pose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Arm Pressure Pose" is like swinging in a cradle. Cross and Squeeze your legs together tightly. Think about floating.... be light. Since it is an awkard starting position do not let manueving into the position, steal your breath.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #34 | Puvottasana
item.description: The "Tabletop & Upside Down Plank" strengthens the neck, arms, wrists and legs. The poses stretch the shoulders, chest and front ankles. Make sure to keep the weight balanced and forward, in the knees and feet, as opposed to the shoulders.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Tabletop & Upside Down Plank"
item.itunes:summary: The "Tabletop & Upside Down Plank" strengthens the neck, arms, wrists and legs. The poses stretch the shoulders, chest and front ankles. Make sure to keep the weight balanced and forward, in the knees and feet, as opposed to the shoulders.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #33 | Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana
item.description: The "Great Toe to Hand Pose" challenges balance. Push the navel up slightly. Use the gaze to keep your eyes from moving. Distribute the weight evenly from the heel mid-point to the ball of the foot. Relax, and be sure to utilize the pranayama breathing pattern.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Great Toe to Hand Pose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Great Toe to Hand Pose" challenges balance. Push the navel up slightly. Use the gaze to keep your eyes from moving. Distribute the weight evenly from the heel mid-point to the ball of the foot. Relax, and be sure to utilize the pranayama breathing pattern.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #32 | Adho Mukha Vrksasana
item.description: The "Handstand" requires balance not brute force. Visual tiptoeing up rolling forward (not jumping) up into the position. Cross and squeeze the thighs together, do not look forward. If falling backwards...relax...tuck the chin to the collarbone and roll, similar to a backwards somersault.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Handstand"
item.itunes:summary: The "Handstand" requires balance not brute force. Visual tiptoeing up rolling forward (not jumping) up into the position. Cross and squeeze the thighs together, do not look forward. If falling backwards...relax...tuck the chin to the collarbone and roll, similar to a backwards somersault.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #31 | Simhasana
item.description: The "Lion" reduces tension in the face and chest. The pose will keep face muscles taught and improve facial circulation, reducing wrinkles around the eyes and mouth. The vocals receive added stimulation from the "Ujjayi" breath doing the roar.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Lion"
item.itunes:summary: The "Lion" reduces tension in the face and chest. The pose will keep face muscles taught and improve facial circulation, reducing wrinkles around the eyes and mouth. The vocals receive added stimulation from the "Ujjayi" breath doing the roar.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #30 | Utkatasana
item.description: The "Chair" or "Lightening Bolt" pose strengthens the ankles, thighs, calves, and spine, while simultaneously stretching shoulders and chest. It stimulates the abdominal organs, diaphragm, and heart. One added benefit, reduces flat feet.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Chair" or "Lightening Bolt"
item.itunes:summary: The "Chair" or "Lightening Bolt" pose strengthens the ankles, thighs, calves, and spine, while simultaneously stretching shoulders and chest. It stimulates the abdominal organs, diaphragm, and heart. One added benefit, reduces flat feet.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #29 | Garudasana
item.description: The "Eagle" improves overall balance, while strengthening ankles and calves. Concentration is also heightened during the breathing and sitting version, as the hips provide a cradling effect.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Eagle"
item.itunes:summary: The "Eagle" improves overall balance, while strengthening ankles and calves. Concentration is also heightened during the breathing and sitting version, as the hips provide a cradling effect.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #28 | Balasana
item.description: The "Childs Pose" gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles, while calming the brain. It assists in relieving stress and fatigue, and reduces back and neck pain.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Childs Pose"
item.itunes:summary: The "Childs Pose" gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles, while calming the brain. It assists in relieving stress and fatigue, and reduces back and neck pain.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #27 | Baddha Konasana
item.description: The "Cobbler" is beneficial for the inner thighs, groins, knees and stimulates the ovaries and the prostate gland. It soothes menstrual discomfort and sciatica, and may relieve symptoms of menopause. Consistent practice late into pregnancy will assist in childbirth.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Cobbler"
item.itunes:summary: The "Cobbler" is beneficial for the inner thighs, groins, knees and stimulates the ovaries and the prostate gland. It soothes menstrual discomfort and sciatica, and may relieve symptoms of menopause. Consistent practice late into pregnancy will assist in childbirth.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #26 | Ardha Chandrasana
item.description: The "Half-Moon" derives its inspiration from the basic nature of life which is in various forms such as human, animals, plants, tress, earth, sun and moon. The Moon from which the name of this pose is derived, is an important part of our life. It touches each individual it in its own manner. It is important to use the lunar and solar power fields to rise up the energy force and use it for the benefit of your body. A focused mind with a profound breath will give you the balance.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Half-Moon"
item.itunes:summary: The "Half-Moon" derives its inspiration from the basic nature of life which is in various forms such as human, animals, plants, tress, earth, sun and moon. The Moon from which the name of this pose is derived, is an important part of our life. It touches each individual it in its own manner. It is important to use the lunar and solar power fields to rise up the energy force and use it for the benefit of your body. A focused mind with a profound breath will give you the balance.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #25 | Vasisthasana
item.description: The "Side Plank" pose requires stamina. It strengthens the arms, wrists, abdominals and leg muscles. The backs of the legs become stretched with active heels as your sense of balance is improved. Toning occurs in the belly, buttocks and "love handles" area.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Side Plank"
item.itunes:summary: The "Side Plank" pose requires stamina. It strengthens the arms, wrists, abdominals and leg muscles. The backs of the legs become stretched with active heels as your sense of balance is improved. Toning occurs in the belly, buttocks and "love handles" area.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #24 | Bitilasana
item.description: The "Cat & Cow" pose coordinates the movement of your entire spine with the action of the complete breath. The dance is graceful and slow, and the union between the body and breath is at the heart of the asana practice. It eases shoulder tension, opens the hips and aids in digestion and elimination.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Cat & Cow"
item.itunes:summary: The "Cat & Cow" pose coordinates the movement of your entire spine with the action of the complete breath. The dance is graceful and slow, and the union between the body and breath is at the heart of the asana practice. It eases shoulder tension, opens the hips and aids in digestion and elimination.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #23 | Marichyasana
item.description: The "Spinal Twist" requires length. Greater extension in the spine permits a deeper sense of breath. Looking up (slightly) with the head and neck in opposition, allows elongation of the spine in a spiraling motion. The arm and knee action provides resistance which aids in twisting, lengthening, and the spiraling effect.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Spinal Twist"
item.itunes:summary: The "Spinal Twist" requires length. Greater extension in the spine permits a deeper sense of breath. Looking up (slightly) with the head and neck in opposition, allows elongation of the spine in a spiraling motion. The arm and knee action provides resistance which aids in twisting, lengthening, and the spiraling effect.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #22 | Bhastrikasana
item.description: The "Bellows" pose simulates the action of squeezing the air out of an accordion. It is an intense routine that engages the entire diaphragm. Be aware of each muscle group within the entire body, as you exhale, rise up and contract the stomach.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Bellows"
item.itunes:summary: The "Bellows" pose simulates the action of squeezing the air out of an accordion. It is an intense routine that engages the entire diaphragm. Be aware of each muscle group within the entire body, as you exhale, rise up and contract the stomach.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #21 | Mukta Hasta Sirsasana
item.description: The support for the "Tripod" or "Hands Free Headstand" is a triangular base formed between the head and hands. Balance is found in the area nearest the central core. Press into the back of the hands and thumbs for increased stability.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Tripod" or "Hands Free Headstand"
item.itunes:summary: The support for the "Tripod" or "Hands Free Headstand" is a triangular base formed between the head and hands. Balance is found in the area nearest the central core. Press into the back of the hands and thumbs for increased stability.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #20 | Vrishikasana
item.description: The "Scorpion" inversion position places a premium on balance and weight distribution, in an awkward stance. If you are unsure, practice on the wall walking your toes down towards the head. This position is not for beginners.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Scorpion"
item.itunes:summary: The "Scorpion" inversion position places a premium on balance and weight distribution, in an awkward stance. If you are unsure, practice on the wall walking your toes down towards the head. This position is not for beginners.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #19 | Thagasana
item.description: The "Surfer" focuses our attention to the back leg. Much like riding a wave the bodies weight should be controlled by the back foot, leg and hip. Too much forward distribution results in loss of balance and a wipeout... Ouch.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Surfer"
item.itunes:summary: The "Surfer" focuses our attention to the back leg. Much like riding a wave the bodies weight should be controlled by the back foot, leg and hip. Too much forward distribution results in loss of balance and a wipeout... Ouch.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #18 | Navasana
item.description: The "Boat" pose will aid in strengthening your core and overall balance. Make sure to engage and lift the bandhas fully. Keep your shoulders relaxed, bending the elbows slightly as you progress to the advanced position.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Boat"
item.itunes:summary: The "Boat" pose will aid in strengthening your core and overall balance. Make sure to engage and lift the bandhas fully. Keep your shoulders relaxed, bending the elbows slightly as you progress to the advanced position.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #17 | Upavishta / Supta Konasana
item.description: The "Seated Angle or Sleeping Angle" pose will aid in understanding balance and where the center of your body should be as you move in coordinated motion with the breath. Be aware of softening the neck as you roll back.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Seated Angle or Sleeping Angle"
item.itunes:summary: The "Seated Angle or Sleeping Angle" pose will aid in understanding balance and where the center of your body should be as you move in coordinated motion with the breath. Be aware of softening the neck as you roll back.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #16 | Parsva Bakasana / Kakasana
item.description: The "Side Angle Crow" or "Crane" pose requires balance as opposed to brute force. Find the center of your being by engaging the bandhas, to create the awareness of gravity, and the sensation of lightness.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Side Angle Crow" or "Crane"
item.itunes:summary: The "Side Angle Crow" or "Crane" pose requires balance as opposed to brute force. Find the center of your being by engaging the bandhas, to create the awareness of gravity, and the sensation of lightness.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #15 | Urdhva / Adho Mudka Svanasana
item.description: In "Upward & Downward Dog" proper timing of inhalation (up) and exhalation (down) is essential for coordinated movement. The pose should be rhythmical, and balanced. Much like a golf swing, making perfect contact with the ball, therefore (at impact), feeling as you are gliding with minimal discomfort.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Upward and Downward Dog"
item.itunes:summary: In "Upward and Downward Dog" proper timing of inhalation (up) and exhalation (down) is essential for coordinated movement. The pose should be rhythmical, and balanced. Much like a golf swing, making perfect contact with the ball, therefore (at impact), feeling as you are gliding with minimal discomfort.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #13-14 | Padmasana and Tolasana
item.description:
In the "Lotus" the spine and shoulders act as a coat-rack. It is a position of calmness, the seat of our practice, whereby one may feel the silent forces moving within.
When performing the "Scale" use the ujjayi breath (contracting of the back the throat) to assist with lifting and balancing action. Equal weight distribution between the fingers and palms is essential, while keeping the wrists relaxed.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Lotus" and "Scale"
item.itunes:summary: In the "Lotus" the spine and shoulders act as a coat-rack. It is a position of calmness, the seat of our practice, whereby one may feel the silent forces moving within.When performing the "Scale" use the ujjayi breath (contracting of the back the throat) to assist with lifting and balancing action. Equal weight distribution between the fingers and palms is essential, while keeping the wrists relaxed.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #12 | Mayurasana
item.description: In the "Peacock" the balance is achieved by a utilization of strong core and engagement of the bandhas. The sensation is that of a teeter-tooter or a perfectly balanced scale. As the feet rise the head works in tandem as a counter balance.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the "Peacock"
item.itunes:summary: In the "Peacock" the balance is achieved by a utilization of strong core and engagement of the bandhas. The sensation is that of a teeter-tooter or a perfectly balanced scale. As the feet rise the head works in tandem as a counter balance.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #11 | Vrkshasana
item.description: The "Tree" aids in balance control. Poor balance is often the result of a restless mind or distracted attention. It improves concentration while cultivating coordination. Since the weight of the entire body is being balanced on one foot, the muscles of that leg are strengthened and toned in total.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Tree"
item.itunes:summary: The "Tree" aids in balance control. Poor balance is often the result of a restless mind or distracted attention. It improves concentration while cultivating coordination. Since the weight of the entire body is being balanced on one foot, the muscles of that leg are strengthened and toned in total.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #10 | Bhujangasana
item.description: The "Cobra" strengthens the spine, lower back, and stretches the muscles in the chest. By maintaining a constant exertion with breath control it is possible to create a greater arch in the spine, whereby the stomach and pelvic muscles are also engaged and strengthened.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Cobra"
item.itunes:summary: The "Cobra" strengthens the spine, lower back, and stretches the muscles in the chest. By maintaining a constant exertion with breath control it is possible to create a greater arch in the spine, whereby the stomach and pelvic muscles are also engaged and strengthened.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #9 | Dhanurasana
item.description: The "Bow" pose is where the arms are like the string of a bow and the body is the bow itself. The energy being propelled via the spine and up through the crown of the head is the arrow...the key is the lift and the dynamic opposition created between the hands and ankles.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Bow"
item.itunes:summary: The "Bow" pose is where the arms are like the string of a bow and the body is the bow itself. The energy being propelled via the spine and up through the crown of the head is the arrow...the key is the lift and the dynamic opposition created between the hands and ankles.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #8 | Ushtrasna
item.description: The "Camel" pose requires active engagement of the legs throught the routine. Be aware of the chest and heart area, pushing up the sky and opening fully, while rolling the shoulders back.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Camel"
item.itunes:summary: The "Camel" pose requires active engagement of the legs throught the routine. Be aware of the chest and heart area, pushing up the sky and opening fully, while rolling the shoulders back.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #7 | Nakrasana
item.description: The "Crocodile" requires a cooperative orchestration of balance and movement. Each toe and finger serves as a spring to bounce the body. The hips lead the endeavor with support form the legs feet, and arms.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Crocodile"
item.itunes:summary: The "Crocodile" requires a cooperative orchestration of balance and movement. Each toe and finger serves as a spring to bounce the body. The hips lead the endeavor with support form the legs feet, and arms.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #6 | Virabhadrasana A,B,C,D
item.description: In the Warrior Poses A,B,D...the back leg should be fully active in A,B, D. Use the outer edge of the foot pressing into the earth. As you release the hips, settling with gravity to the earth. The find the center and balance with your torso, and extend up from the sacrum through the spine so energy flows out from the fingers...
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Warrior Poses"
item.itunes:summary: In the Warrior Poses A,B,D...the back leg should be fully active in A,B, D. Use the outer edge of the foot pressing into the earth. As you release the hips, settling with gravity to the earth. The find the center and balance with your torso, and extend up from the sacrum through the spine so energy flows out from the fingers...
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #5 | Dirga Pranayama
item.description: The single most important foundation to your yoga practice.
item.itunes:subtitle: The single most important foundation to your yoga practice.
item.itunes:summary: The single most important foundation to your yoga practice.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #4 | Utthita Parsvakonasana
item.description: In the "Side Angle Pose," pressing the front knee against the arm will increase the rotation and energy level to the torso. Lifting the toes on the back foot will give you a greater understanding of the complete balance and power necessary in the back leg.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Side Angle Pose"
item.itunes:summary: In the "Side Angle Pose," pressing the front knee against the arm will increase the rotation and energy level to the torso. Lifting the toes on the back foot will give you a greater understanding of the complete balance and power necessary in the back leg.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #3 | Utthita Trikonasana
item.description: In the "Triangle" the torso rolls open, aligning the shoulders with the front leg, while lengthening the spine from the sacrum to the crown of the head. Widen the shoulders by extending energy via the arms and fingertips.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Triangle"
item.itunes:summary: In the "Triangle" the torso rolls open, aligning the shoulders with the front leg, while lengthening the spine from the sacrum to the crown of the head. Widen the shoulders by extending energy via the arms and fingertips.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #2 | Bakasana
item.description: The "Crow" or "Crane" pose requires balance as opposed to brute force. Find the center of your being by engaging the bandhas, to create the awareness of gravity, and the sensation of lightness.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "Crow" or "Crane"
item.itunes:summary: The "Crow" or "Crane" pose requires balance as opposed to brute force. Find the center of your being by engaging the bandhas, to create the awareness of gravity, and the sensation of lightness.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller

item.title: Episode #1 | Parivritta Trikonasana
item.description: The revolving version of the triangle is designed to lengthen the spine, spiraling energy and motion from the scarum to the crown of the head.
item.itunes:subtitle: The revolving version of the triangle
item.itunes:summary: The revolving version of the triangle is designed to lengthen the spine, spiraling energy and motion from the scarum to the crown of the head.
item.itunes:keywords: video, yoga, california, ashtanga, learning, martial arts, pilates, tai chi, qiqong, ballet, instruction
item.itunes:author: Byron Miller
